Understate: The claim understates the limitations and potential problems with the protections on pre-existing conditions that were present before the Affordable Care Act (ACA) was implemented.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the protections on pre-existing conditions have been consistently strong since the 1970s, which is not accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that pre-existing condition protections have been in place since the 1970s.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that pre-existing condition protections in North Dakota have not been consistently strong or comprehensive.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations and does not consider the limitations and potential consequences of the pre-existing condition protections that were in place before the ACA.
